title: Introduction to quantrr
text: “standalone” version quantrr provides files needed create reports using quantrr, intended want get started quickly, new R don’t existing development publishing workflow. standalone version requires R Quarto. Note many ways install use R Quarto generate reports. instructions designed make easy get started quantrr. approaches, consult R quarto documentation. setup documented rdev.

title: Introduction to quantrr
text: install standalone version quantrr Windows: Download install latest version R Windows. Download install Quarto CLI. “code” menu https://github.com/jabenninghoff/quantrr/, select “Download ZIP”. Extract “standalone” directory ZIP file move “Documents” Launch R, run following commands: see following R console executing source("setup.R"):  may see additional prompts: “like use personal library instead?” “like create personal library  install packages ?” , select “Yes” . Additionally, prompted, choose Secure CRAN mirror (“0-Cloud [https]”).

title: Introduction to quantrr
text: install standalone version quantrr macOS: Download install latest version R macOS. Choose appropriate version hardware (Apple silicon Intel). Download install Quarto CLI. “code” menu https://github.com/jabenninghoff/quantrr/, select “Download ZIP”. Extract “standalone” directory ZIP file move home directory (“/Users/”). Launch R, run following commands: see following R console executing source("setup.R"):  prompted, choose Secure CRAN mirror (“0-Cloud [https]”). asked install command line developer tools, please .

title: Introduction to quantrr
text: standalone version contains example analysis “Widget Management System”. everything correctly installed, running following command R Console generate launch website locally system: time launch R, need set working directory standalone directory using setwd("standalone"). three scripts can use build manage report: source("preview.R") - generates launches report web browser source("render.R") - generates report saves html directory source("clean.R") - deletes quarto intermediate files html directory

title: Introduction to quantrr
text: Collect data using copy widgetsys.xlsx spreadsheet. reporting tool uses two tabs, “Risks” “Estimates”, tabs ignored. Risks sheet used scoping assessment, two columns: “Risk”, short name risk, also used Estimates tab “Description”, long description risk set limit number risks, must unique must least one risk. Estimates sheet used gathering estimates Subject Matter Experts, 6 columns: “Risk”, short name risk, must match one risks Risk tab “Expert”, name identifier SME providing estimate “Frequency (per year)”, average number times event expected occur per year, used value λ\lambda Poisson loss frequency distribution. Fractional values represent every 1x\frac{1}{x} years; every 4 years 0.25. “Low (5%)”, estimate low (5th percentile) value single loss event. “High (95%)”, estimate high (95th percentile) value single loss event. “Likely”, estimate median (50th percentile) value single loss event. Low High values used calculate parameters log-normal loss magnitude distribution, Likely used check see close estimates fit log-normal. SMEs can provide estimates one risks, estimates can left blank. Typically confidence loss frequency loss magnitude.

title: Quantify and Report (Technology) Risk
text: Quantify Report (Technology) Risk: streamlined tool designed make easier quantify risk using expert estimation. Given expert estimates loss frequency magnitude, generate report forecasts losses risk aggregate. First presented demo 2024 SIRAcon talk, “UnFAIR: Simplifying Expanding Technology Risk Quantification.” rendered version standalone sample report available .

title: Quantify and Report (Technology) Risk
text: Detailed instructions available Introduction quantrr vignette. Install latest version R platform. Download install Quarto CLI. Download extract “standalone” directory repository. Launch R set working directory “standalone” directory. Run source("setup.R") install required R packages. Run source("preview.R") build display example analysis.

title: Calculate Risk — calc_risk
text: Calculate risk using Poisson log-normal model. number events per time period calculated using rpois(runs, lambda) total loss time period using sum(rlnorm(events, meanlog, sdlog)).

title: Calculate Risk — calc_risk
text: risk Risk name (string) lambda Parameter passed rpois() meanlog Parameter passed rlnorm() sdlog Parameter passed rlnorm() runs Number simulations

title: Calculate Risk — calc_risk
text: tibble runs rows containing number events (events), total value losses (losses) run.

text: FALSE validation failures resulted errors warnings, otherwise TRUE, invisibly.

title: Geometric Mean — gmean
text: Geometric mean, exp(mean(log(x)). NA values removed na.rm TRUE.

text: Returns NaN x includes negative values.

title: Calculate Log Normal Parameters — lnorm_param
text: Calculate parameters log normal distribution estimated 0.05 0.95 quantile. Also calculate fractional difference estimated median value (0.5 quantile) median value calculated 0.05 0.95 values.

title: Calculate Log Normal Parameters — lnorm_param
text: p05 "low" value, 0.05 quantile. p95 "high" value, 0.95 quantile. p50 likely value, 0.5 quantile.

title: Calculate Log Normal Parameters — lnorm_param
text: list including meanlog sdlog parameters, well fractional difference estimated actual median (0.5 quantile), mdiff.

what: quantrr: Quantify and Report (Technology) Risk — quantrr-package
title: quantrr: Quantify and Report (Technology) Risk — quantrr-package
text: streamlined tool designed make easier quantify risk using expert estimation. Given expert estimates loss frequency magnitude, generate report forecasts losses risk aggregate.

title: quantrr: Quantify and Report (Technology) Risk — quantrr-package
text: Maintainer: John Benninghoff jbenninghoff@mac.com (ORCID)

Widget Management System (WMS) 30 years old architecture changed significantly since original implementation. years, widget system become integral part services managing widgets clients. reviewing system, three major risks identified: First, age technology prevents updating components system longer meet contemporary cybersecurity standards, increases risk breach. Second, system less reliable experiences frequent outages, typically 2 major outages per year, results lost revenue, contractual penalties, overtime pay recover incident. Third, limitations widget system started affect sales - recently lost customer due functional obsolescence widget system, expect lose existing prospective customers future due increased competition widget management market.
Import validate data Excel. data collected 3 Technology SMEs, 3 Business SMEs, one SME experience . Experts calibrated, informed historical industry data, gave estimates areas confident answering.
code: risks <- read_xlsx(report_file, sheet = "Risks") |>   clean_names()  validate_risks <- local({   validate_rules <- validator(     risk_char = is.character(risk),     risk_not_na = !is.na(risk),     risk_not_blank = is.nzchar(risk, keep_na = TRUE),     desc_char = is.character(description),     desc_not_na = !is.na(description),     desc_not_blank = is.nzchar(risk, keep_na = TRUE)   )   confront(risks, validate_rules) })  check_validation(validate_risks, sheet = "Risks")  estimates <- read_xlsx(report_file, sheet = "Estimates") |>   clean_names() |>   rename(     lambda = frequency_per_yer, p05 = low_5_percent, p95 = high_95_percent, p50 = most_likely   )  validate_estimates <- local({   validate_rules <- validator(     risk_not_na = !is.na(risk),     risk_match = risk %in% risks$risk,     expert_char = is.character(expert),     expert_not_na = !is.na(expert),     expert_not_blank = is.nzchar(expert, keep_na = TRUE),     lambda_num = is.numeric(lambda),     lambda_pos = lambda > 0,     p05_num = is.numeric(p05),     p05_pos = p05 > 0,     p95_num = is.numeric(p95),     p95_pos = p95 > 0,     p50_num = is.numeric(p50),     p50_pos = p50 > 0   )   confront(estimates, validate_rules) })  check_validation(validate_estimates, sheet = "Estimates")

text: Risk descriptions:
Forecast risk using Monte Carlo simulation. average events, losses, ‘typical’ losses (geometric mean), percentage years losses risk summarized :
code: consensus <- estimates |>   group_by(risk) |>   summarize(across(lambda:p50, ~ mean(.x, na.rm = TRUE)))  consensus_params <- consensus |>   mutate(as_tibble(lnorm_param(.data$p05, .data$p95, .data$p50)))  forecast <- consensus_params |>   select(c("risk", "lambda", "meanlog", "sdlog")) |>   pmap(calc_risk) |>   list_rbind()  forecast |>   group_by(risk) |>   mutate(no_losses = events == 0) |>   summarize(     avg_events = mean(events), avg_losses = mean(losses), typ_losses = gmean(losses),     no_losses = mean(no_losses)   ) |>   mutate(     across(avg_losses:typ_losses, ~ currency(.x, digits = 0L)),     no_losses = percent(no_losses)   ) |>   formattable(align = "l")

text: Losses risk separately aggregate:
code: forecast |>   # remove zero losses to plot using log10 scale   filter(losses > 0) |>   ggplot(aes(losses)) +   facet_grid(vars(risk)) +   geom_histogram(color = "black", fill = "white", bins = 100) +   scale_x_log10(labels = scales::label_currency(scale_cut = scales::cut_short_scale())) +   labs(x = NULL, y = NULL, title = "Losses by Risk") +   theme_minimal() forecast |>   filter(losses > 0) |>   ggplot(aes(losses, fill = risk)) +   geom_histogram(bins = 100) +   scale_x_log10(labels = scales::label_currency(scale_cut = scales::cut_short_scale())) +   labs(x = NULL, y = NULL, fill = "Risk", title = "Total Losses") +   scale_fill_viridis_d() +   theme_minimal()

text: Plot loss exceedance curves risks combined risk. Plot loss exceedance curves risk:  Interactive plot: Plot loss exceedance curve combined risk:  Interactive plot:
code: risk_le <- forecast |>   group_by(risk) |>   mutate(probability = 1 - percent_rank(losses)) |>   filter(losses > 0) |>   ungroup() |>   mutate(losses = currency(losses, digits = 0), probability = percent(probability)) |>   ggplot(aes(losses, probability)) +   facet_grid(vars(risk)) +   geom_line() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::label_percent(), limits = c(0, 1)) +   scale_x_log10(labels = scales::label_currency(scale_cut = scales::cut_short_scale())) +   labs(x = NULL, y = NULL, title = "Loss Exceedance by Risk") +   theme_minimal()  risk_le ggplotly(risk_le) combined_le <- forecast |>   group_by(year) |>   summarize(total_losses = sum(losses)) |>   mutate(probability = 1 - percent_rank(total_losses)) |>   filter(total_losses > 0) |>   ungroup() |>   mutate(total_losses = currency(total_losses, digits = 0), probability = percent(probability)) |>   ggplot(aes(total_losses, probability)) +   geom_line() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::label_percent(), limits = c(0, 1)) +   scale_x_log10(labels = scales::label_currency(scale_cut = scales::cut_short_scale())) +   labs(x = NULL, y = NULL, title = "Combined Loss Exceedance") +   theme_minimal()  combined_le ggplotly(combined_le)

text: Plot loss exceedance curves risk:  Interactive plot:
code: risk_le <- forecast |>   group_by(risk) |>   mutate(probability = 1 - percent_rank(losses)) |>   filter(losses > 0) |>   ungroup() |>   mutate(losses = currency(losses, digits = 0), probability = percent(probability)) |>   ggplot(aes(losses, probability)) +   facet_grid(vars(risk)) +   geom_line() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::label_percent(), limits = c(0, 1)) +   scale_x_log10(labels = scales::label_currency(scale_cut = scales::cut_short_scale())) +   labs(x = NULL, y = NULL, title = "Loss Exceedance by Risk") +   theme_minimal()  risk_le ggplotly(risk_le)

text: Plot loss exceedance curve combined risk:  Interactive plot:
code: combined_le <- forecast |>   group_by(year) |>   summarize(total_losses = sum(losses)) |>   mutate(probability = 1 - percent_rank(total_losses)) |>   filter(total_losses > 0) |>   ungroup() |>   mutate(total_losses = currency(total_losses, digits = 0), probability = percent(probability)) |>   ggplot(aes(total_losses, probability)) +   geom_line() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::label_percent(), limits = c(0, 1)) +   scale_x_log10(labels = scales::label_currency(scale_cut = scales::cut_short_scale())) +   labs(x = NULL, y = NULL, title = "Combined Loss Exceedance") +   theme_minimal()  combined_le ggplotly(combined_le)

text: Additional details risk quantification analysis. Data validation results Risks tab:  Data validation results Estimates tab:  risk estimates: Using simple average experts provided estimate (blank/NA), gives us consensus estimate three risks : consensus estimates p05 p95 result following parameters log-normal loss magnitude. p50 estimate used calculate percentage difference actual median (mdiff), measure estimate accuracy: summary() forecast results.
code: plot(validate_risks) plot(validate_estimates) estimates |>   mutate(across(p05:p50, ~ currency(.x, digits = 0L))) |>   formattable(align = "l") consensus |>   mutate(across(p05:p50, ~ currency(.x, digits = 0L))) |>   formattable(align = "l") consensus_params |>   mutate(across(p05:p50, ~ currency(.x, digits = 0L)), mdiff = percent(mdiff)) |>   formattable(align = "l") summary(forecast) year           risk               events           losses           Min.   :    1   Length:150000      Min.   : 0.000   Min.   :0.000e+00    1st Qu.:12501   Class :character   1st Qu.: 0.000   1st Qu.:0.000e+00    Median :25000   Mode  :character   Median : 1.000   Median :3.519e+04    Mean   :25000                      Mean   : 1.417   Mean   :5.844e+06    3rd Qu.:37500                      3rd Qu.: 2.000   3rd Qu.:1.442e+06    Max.   :50000                      Max.   :11.000   Max.   :9.880e+10

text: Data validation results Risks tab:  Data validation results Estimates tab:
risk estimates:

Using simple average experts provided estimate (blank/NA), gives us consensus estimate three risks : consensus estimates p05 p95 result following parameters log-normal loss magnitude. p50 estimate used calculate percentage difference actual median (mdiff), measure estimate accuracy:
code: consensus |>   mutate(across(p05:p50, ~ currency(.x, digits = 0L))) |>   formattable(align = "l") consensus_params |>   mutate(across(p05:p50, ~ currency(.x, digits = 0L)), mdiff = percent(mdiff)) |>   formattable(align = "l")

text: summary() forecast results.
code: summary(forecast) year           risk               events           losses           Min.   :    1   Length:150000      Min.   : 0.000   Min.   :0.000e+00    1st Qu.:12501   Class :character   1st Qu.: 0.000   1st Qu.:0.000e+00    Median :25000   Mode  :character   Median : 1.000   Median :3.519e+04    Mean   :25000                      Mean   : 1.417   Mean   :5.844e+06    3rd Qu.:37500                      3rd Qu.: 2.000   3rd Qu.:1.442e+06    Max.   :50000                      Max.   :11.000   Max.   :9.880e+10

title: quantrr 1.1.0
text: Updated Standalone Quarto site example: Replaced stopifnot() import data validation check warnings review validation results Added ‘typical’ losses Forecast section using geometric mean Added percentage years losses Forecast section Loss Exceedance Curves now use log10 scale improve readability Added new functions: gmean(): calculate geometric mean check_validation(): raise warnings issues data validation updates: Updated Template match Standalone site example Add rendered standalone report sample online documentation

title: quantrr 1.0.0
text: First full release. Includes following features: “Risk Analysis Report” R Markdown Template RStudio “Standalone” Quarto site implements template includes “Widget Management System” example Full documentation https://jabenninghoff.github.io/quantrr/ Quick Start Guide README Planned, yet implemented: Logo/Icon “Risk Modeling quantrr” vignette

title: quantrr 0.1.0
text: Initial release. Implements basic package structure two core functions: lnorm_param(): calculate parameters log normal distribution 0.05 0.95 quantiles calc_risk(): quantify risk using Poisson distribution loss event frequency, log-normal distribution loss event magnitude
